description:
The Wars of the Roses grip medieval England as the houses of York and Lancaster vie for the throne. Richard is the third son of the Duke of York, who plans to take the crown. Richard wants nothing more than for this to happen, but this innocent wish will plunge England further into the chaos of war. Meanwhile, Richard is struggling with a battle far more personal.

(Source: Funimation)
synonyms: พันธนาการแห่งราชันย์กุหลาบ

tags.name: Historical
tags.description: Partly or completely set during a real period of world history.

tags.name: Classic Literature
tags.description: Discusses or adapts a work of classic world literature.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Politics
tags.description: Centers around politics, politicians, or government activities.

tags.name: Boys' Love
tags.description: Prominently features romance between two males, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: Bisexual
tags.description: Features a character who is romantically or sexually attracted to people of more than one sex or gender.

tags.name: Shoujo
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult females.

tags.name: Foreign
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a country outside the country of origin.

tags.name: Ghost
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a ghost.

tags.name: War
tags.description: Partly or completely set during wartime.

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Male Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several male characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Transgender
tags.description: Features a character whose gender identity differs from the sex they were assigned at birth.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Age Gap
tags.description: Prominently features romantic relations between people with a significant age difference.

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

tags.name: Medieval
tags.description: Partially or completely set in the Middle Ages or a Middle Ages-inspired setting. Commonly features elements such as European castles and knights.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kanno_aya) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/ayakannoofficial) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/kannoaya/)

Japanese shoujo manga artist. She is the former assistant of mangaka [Masashi Asaki](https://anilist.co/staff/97577/) of Psychometrer Eiji fame. Her debut was in the January 2001 issue of Hana to Yume with Soul Rescue. Thus far, her work has only been serialized in Hakusensha's shoujo manga anthologies: Hana to Yume, Za Hana to Yume, Hana to Yume Purasu, Bessatsu Hana to Yume and then Princess Magazine, which serialized her latest series Requiem of the Rose King, ending in January 2022 with 17 volumes.
Worked as a producer in the beginning of his career.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/chikara923vn)

Affiliated with [J.C. Staff](https://anilist.co/studio/7/), where he is one of the studio's leading animators.
Affiliated with [J.C. Staff](https://anilist.co/studio/7/), where he is one of the art directors.

[Profile](https://www.imagine-music.co.jp/artist/index/9) | [Twitter](http://twitter.com/kowotani)

After graduating from university, he became a founding member of Yuji Saito's music production company IMAGINE in November 1986. The company has grown to feature musicians like Kohei Tanaka, Shiro Hamaguchi, Hayato Matsuo, and Shinji Miyazaki, who have become well known for cinematic scoring and orchestration through Otani. 

In 1987, he made his debut as an anime composer with the popular manga adaptation City Hunter, which earned him recognition in the industry. He later went on to work on titles such as Spy Games (1988), The Ultimate Teacher (1988), The Yadamura Waltz (1988), and You're Under Arrest (1994). The anime Future GPX Cyber Formula (1991) and Mobile Suit Gundam Wing (1995) and several films in the Gamera series are some of his most well-known works.  In 2001, he created the score to the film Godzilla, Mothra and King Ghidorah: Giant Monsters All-Out Attack. Other notable scores by Otani include Outlaw Star (1998), Gundam Wing: Endless Waltz (1998), Cross Fire (2000), The SoulTaker (2001), Haibane Renmei (2002), Zatch Bell! (2003), Eyeshield 21 (2005), Pumpkin Scissors (2006), Deltora Quest (2007), and Over Drive (2007). He has also been the music director and keyboardist of the band Dreams Come True. He appeared at Eminence Symphony Orchestra's events A Night in Fantasia 2007: Symphonic Games Edition and Unearthing Eden ~The sounds of AINARU~ in 2007.  

Throughout his career, Otani has also composed music for several video games, making his debut with the 1995 shooter game Philosoma. In 2000, he created the soundtrack to the flight simulator Sky Odyssey. He scored Shadow of the Colossus in 2005, his most famous video game work. Otani was responsible for composing the music for Wild Arms: Twilight Venom (2000), an anime adaptation of the Wild Arms video game series; he also arranged compositions of Michiko Naruke's music from the series. He did two more video game to anime adaptations: Night Warriors: Darkstalkers' Revenge (1997) and Popolocrois Monogatari (1998). In 2005, he created the track "Madness" alongside Hiroko Shigezumi for the Square Enix game Heavy Metal Thunder.

[Website](https://zaqzaqzaq.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/zaxic_r) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/zaq39/)

ZAQ began to learn the piano at age three. During her college years, her idol was Minori Chihara, and it was during this time she decided to become a singer. However, she failed all her auditions. In junior high school, her favorite bands were Mongol800 and Going Steady, two rock groups which she was addicted to. Self-taught, her composing and works were characterized by a unique style which is unrestricted by music theory and musicology.

__Agency:__ Toy's Factory

[Profile](http://www.toysfactory.co.jp/artist/makotofurukawa/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/m_furukawa929)

**Non-Anime Roles**:
- Gepard - Honkai: Star Rail (VG)
- Ichige Hokuto - Hanaemu Kare to & bloom (VG)

The founder and representative director of [J.C. Staff](https://anilist.co/studio/7/).

In 1976, Miyata joined [Tatsunoko Production](https://anilist.co/studio/103/), and was assigned to the planning and literature department. Three years later he moved to being a producer.  After having left Tatsunoko he joined [Kitty Film](https://anilist.co/studio/99/) for some time before founding J.C. Staff in 1986.

After producing numerous works for J.C. Staff in the late '80s and throughout the '90s - he shifted his focus to a more managerial position in 2000, a position which he still holds to this day while serving as the studio's representative director.

William Shakespeare was an English playwright, poet, and actor. He was known as the greatest writer in English language and world's greatest dramatist. He is often called England's national poet, also known as "The Bard of Avon". Shakespeare was born and raised in Stratford-upon-Avon, Warwickshire.

Shakespeare produced most of his known works between 1589 and 1613. His early plays were primarily comedies and histories and are regarded as some of the best work produced in these genres. Until about 1608, he wrote mainly tragedies, among them Hamlet, Othello, King Lear, and Macbeth, all considered to be among the finest works in the English language. In the last phase of his life, he wrote tragicomedies (also known as romances) and collaborated with other playwrights. 

Throughout the 20th and 21st centuries, Shakespeare's works have been continually adapted and rediscovered by new movements in scholarship and performance. His plays remain popular and are studied, performed, and reinterpreted through various cultural and political contexts around the world. 

Shakespeare died on 23 April 1616, at the age of 52. He was buried in The Collegiate Church of the Holy and Undivided Trinity, Stratford-upon-Avon, Warwickshire, England.

(Source: Wikipedia)

[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/america_torres_doblaje/)

A Mexican voice actress. She is married to [Esteban Desco](https://anilist.co/staff/184302/Esteban-Desco) and is the mother of [Ethien](https://anilist.co/staff/313467/Ethien-Desco) and [Natalia](https://anilist.co/staff/313468/Natalia-Desco).
